newsitem.title: USA: Kansas wheat in mostly good to excellent condition.
newsitem.headline: Kansas wheat in mostly good to excellent condition.

text.p: THe Kansas winter wheat crop remained in mostly good to excellent condition during the week ended Sunday, the state's agricultural statistics service said Monday in its weekly crop weather report.
Wheat condition was rated 20 percent excellent, 65 percent good, 13 percent fair and two percent poor, compared to last week's rating of 19 percent excellent, 68 good, 11 fair and two poor.
As of Sunday, 23 percent of the wheat crop was jointing compared to two percent in 1996 and the average of 15 percent.

Wind damage to wheat was reported to be three percent moderate to severe, 14 percent light and 83 percent undamaged. Wheat freeze damage remained unchanged with one percent moderate, eight percent light and 91 percent undamaged.
Insect and disease infestations remained minimal, with a few reports of armyworms, greenbugs and leaf rust in isolated areas.
Seeding of oats progressed to 98 percent complete, ahead of 84 percent last year and the average of 75 percent.

Topsoil moisture condition declined and was rated 36 percent short to very short, 59 adequate and five surplus. Subsoil moisture was rated 14 percent short to very short, 83 percent adequate and three percent surplus, the report said.
